intro: Exacum racemosum, commonly known as the clustered blue-eyed grass, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Primulaceae and is characterized by its clusters of small, showy blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments and has lance-shaped leaves. It produces numerous flowers along a raceme, giving it its common name. Exacum racemosum is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and greenhouses.
